results.title: Atenolol-induced breast pain in a woman with hypertension.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To describe a case of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-induced @DISEASE_Mastodynia @DISEASE_MESH:D059373 @@@breast pain and swelling@@@ in a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Risk of insomnia attributable to beta-blockers in elderly patients with newly diagnosed hypertension.
results.text_hl: The use of @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was associated with the lowest risk of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ in elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, as compared to @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@. beta-Blockers with high selectivity in beta(1)-receptors and/or low lipophilicity were associated with a lower risk of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@.

citations.NLM: Chang CH, Yang YH, Lin SJ, Su JJ, Cheng CL, Lin LJ. Risk of insomnia attributable to beta-blockers in elderly patients with newly diagnosed hypertension. Drug Metab Pharmacokinet. 2013;28(1):53-8. PMID: 22813717

results.title: Effects of sympatholytic therapy on postmenopausal symptoms in hypertensive postmenopausal women.
results.text_hl: In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group, @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ and GIS were reduced significantly, with relief of symptoms occurring in 33% and 27% of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Kujala SM, Pöyhönen-Alho M, Kaaja RJ. Effects of sympatholytic therapy on postmenopausal symptoms in hypertensive postmenopausal women. Climacteric. 2014 Aug;17(4):356-62. PMID: 24099152

results.title: Long-term clinical experience with atenolol--a new selective beta-1-blocker with few side-effects from the central nervous system.
results.text_hl: Of the 51 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who complained of or showed side-effects from another beta-blocker, 80% were improved after changing to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@. Of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with side-effects from the central nervous system, 73% improved, especially those who complained of nightmares, @DISEASE_Hallucinations @DISEASE_MESH:D006212 @@@hallucinations@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ or mild @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@.

citations.NLM: Henningsen NC, Mattiasson I. Long-term clinical experience with atenolol--a new selective beta-1-blocker with few side-effects from the central nervous system. Acta Med Scand. 1979;205(1-2):61-6. PMID: 367088
